In the world of science, the legacy of a black man from Alabama loons as large as any in the 20th century.
Percy Julian broke the color barrier in chemistry through his work with the soybean, an innovation that made drugs like Cortisone affordable.
Yet his name isn't as familiar as some other prominent figures in black history.
But now he is the subject of a documentary aptly titled ""Forgotten Genius."" Tony Award winning actor Ruben Santiago-Hudson portrays the legend.
